short_summary: Regulatory dry docking of CCGS Sir Wilfred Grenfell
description: Vessel details: Length (m) -67m, Breadth (m) - 15m, Draft (m) - 6.0 m, Gross Tonnage (t) - 3661.3. The vessel will be taken out of service for a period from Jan 10th 2022 until Feb 15th 2023 for the Regulatory docking. The scope of the work will include the dry docking of the vessel and various Regulatory inspections and repairs. Estimated cost - $4,000,000. The estimated timeline is from Jan 10th 2023 to Feb 15th 2023
full_summary:
Advance Contract Award Notice

**Contract Title:** CCGS Sir Wilfred Grenfell - Dry Docking
**Contract Reference Number:** PW-_XLV-591-8410
**Solicitation Number:** F1782-22C048/B
**Publication Date:** 2022-12-13
**Tender Closing Date:** 2022-12-28T17:00:00
**Trade Agreement:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
**Procurement Category:** SRVTGD (Specific goods or services for a specific purpose)
**Procurement Method:** Non-Competitive
**Description:**

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is issuing an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) for the dry docking of the CCGS Sir Wilfred Grenfell, a High-Endurance Multi-Tasked Vessel owned by Fisheries and Oceans Canada. The contract value is estimated at $4,000,000.

**Scope of Work:**

The scope of work includes the dry docking of the vessel, various regulatory inspections, and repairs. The vessel will be taken out of service from January 10th, 2023, to February 15th, 2023.

**Definition of the Requirement:**

The CCGS Sir Wilfred Grenfell is a 67-meter long, 15-meter wide, and 6.0-meter draft vessel with a gross tonnage of 3,661.3 tonnes. The vessel was constructed in 1986 and operates in the Canadian Coast Guard's Western Region.

**Statutory Requirements:**

The Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) is applicable to this procurement, and the NWB Act is applicable to this procurement.

**Pre-identified Supplier:**

Vancouver Drydock Company Ltd. has been identified as the pre-identified supplier due to their ability to meet the requirements set out in the notice. Any interested supplier who wishes to express their interest must submit a statement of capabilities in writing to Eric Zwarich, Supply Team Leader, Acquisitions Marine, Procurement Branch / Pacific Region by the closing date of this notice.

**Inquiries and Contact:**

Inquiries and statements of capabilities should be directed to Eric Zwarich via email at Eric.Zwarich@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca or by phone at (250) 661-2347.

**Crown's Right to Negotiate:**

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
